    • Method Detail

      • getNameVariable

        public static NonXVariable getNameVariable()
        gets the name of the polynomial (i.e. the letter before the equals sign, the a in a = 3 + x^2) that was evaluated by readPoly() from the inputString.
        Returns:
        NonXVariable the name of the input expression

      • getTokenList

        public java.util.ArrayDeque<Token> getTokenList()
        gets the resulting list after the inputString is evaluated, to be passed to InfixToPostfix
        Returns:
        ArrayDeque the ArrayDeque of tokens.

      • readPoly

        public java.util.ArrayDeque<Token> readPoly()
        A Finite State Machine that reads the user inputted string and evaluates it to make a list of tokens.
        Returns:
        ArrayDeque a list of tokens if the string has ended in an accepting state ( is a valid stirng), otherwise null. However, because of exceptions being thrown instead it is very unlikely to return null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if
